bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, March 5, 1941

div1.p: Kean discusses a book he is reading about Finlay. He agrees to write a letter to Ramos.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, March 5, 1941
div1.p:
I have been reading casually from time to
time in Dr. Francisco Dominguez's book Carlos J.
Finlay Son Centenaire (1833) Sa Deconverte 1881
which is very well written-in french- and has a
number of errors and many interesting things
in it. I note on page 122 (I translate as I dont know
what facility you have in french).

“The American Commission, to make its experiments,
established itself at Los Quemdos in the San José
estate where Finlay had formerly made his experi-
ments and where in 1883 he had inoculated the Rev.
Father Urra, a case which was seen by many doctors
and accepted by all as positive for yellow fever-”

I wonder if this is a fact- The son Dr. Carlos E-
Finlay in his recent book, which you have, says (on
page 82) that the Urra case was at a property owned
by the Jesuits called La Asuncion- If it was a fact,
it is odd that Finlay Jr, did not refer to it in his
book- There is also an account in Dominguez's
book pages 132-133 of the famous dinner given
by the physicians of Havana in honor of Finlay
to celebrate the demonstration of his mosquito theory by
the Reed Board - My diary says that it was gotten up
by Dr Guiteras, but he says that Gen. Wood proposed it, and
2
send Guiteras to him (Dominguez) asking him to join him Wood
in getting it up- At any rate it was a five occasion- Reed
and his assistants were there and Finlay and of course
Gen. Wood - Gorgas was there also and Dominguez
evidently thought that he was the Chief Surgeon of
Cuba and so states in this & several places in this book. In
fact however he was only the Chief Surgeon of the City
of Havana. Col. Valery Havard was the Chief Surgeon
of Cuba, but was at this time absent on leave in the U.S.
and I was Acting Chief Surgeon in his place- It was
for this reason, I suppose, that I was seated by Dr.
Finlay at the dinner- The note about the drinner in
my diary is very brief and does not mention either
Dr. Dominguez or his presentation of the bronze “La
Pensée”, His account is also not complete in that
it does not mention the praises given to Dr. Reed
But the aim of the book is clearly to minimize the impor-
tance of Reed's work- He has opposite page 192 a good
picture of the Schuler bust of Reed which is evidently
to bring in the inscription which names Reed as the
“head of the Commission that discovered and demonstrated
the transmission ” This sounded queer to me, so
I phoned to find out what is the inscription under the
bust which has been since 1934 at Walter Reed
Hospital- The inscription is simply WALTER REED not
a word more- Then I inquired what inscription
is under the bronze replica, made also by Schuler at the
3
Army Medical Museum- That has no inscription, not
even the name- So I was puzzled to find out
where he got it, and finally got the Curator of
the branch of the National Museum on Independence Ave - to see what
he could find in his records- The bust was
deposited there when first made- He finally
found a photograph of it with a record of the
inscription which Dominguez has quoted- So when
I wrote to thank Dr. Dominguez for his book I men-
tioned that I could not recall the inscription and
on inquiry found that it had been removed
from the bust, before the publication of his book-
I have written this out fully because you may hear of
this tale in Cuba and I want you to be able to contra-
dict it. Dr Angle's wrote me that this bust and
inscription were at the Capitol - so I have set
him straight on that also-

Before finishing the above the afternoon mail arrived
with your big air envelope containing your letter to
me of yesterday & the copy of your letter and report to
Dr. Domingo Ramos with the numerous photographs
photostats & so on- You have certainly not omitted
anything in the way of evidence to convince him &
all Cuba of the correctness of your contentions-
I will write the letter tomorrow to Dr Ramos and
return the inclosures with that. This I will get off
in a few minutes. I wouldwill send it by air mail
AC
K
I had a phone message from the Army Medical
Museum this noon saying that they have found
the contract between Walter Reed and Antonio
Benigno which I had framed & hanging on
the wall of my office as Seey Mil. Surgeons-
It was removed by some unknown person and
a picture pasted over it so it could not be
recognized when search cards was made for it-
Col. Siler will have a photograph of it made
for you.

You are a wonder! How you can do so
much and so thoroughly I cannot imagine
